Author: Caxton, William; Rhys, John; Malory, Thomas; Nathan Comfort Starr Collection of Arthuriana; Rhys, John; Beardsley, Aubrey
Title: The birth life and acts of King Arthur: of his noble Knights of the Round Table their marvellous enquests and adventures the achieving of the San Greal and in the end Le morte Darthur with the dolourous death and departing out of this world of them all
Short Title: The birth life and acts of King Arthur
Notes:
Format

liv, 624 pages, 25 unnumbered leaves of plates : illustrations ; 27 cm

4to.

Edition

2nd ed.

Notes

Half title: Morte Darthur.

Text modernized by F.J. Simmons.

"This, the second edition of Le Morte Darthur, with Aubrey Beardsley's designs (and which is now issued in a single volume), is limited to 1000 copies for the United Kingdom and 500 for America, after printing which the type has been distributed"--Preliminary page.

Illustrations include 10 designs for chapter headings omitted from 1st ed., which first appear in this ed. on p. 75, 113, 128, 133, 166, 276, 302, 330, 332, and 402.

Double page ills. counted as 2 plates each in collation.

Bound in green cloth, with designs by Beardsley as 1st ed., except design on upper cover reversed and device on lower cover blind and centered.

Walker, R.A. Le morte Darthur with Beardsley illustrations.

Gallatin, A.E. Beardsley, p. 36

Wesleyan copy: With bookplates and signature of Nathan Comfort Starr.
